alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 11:55PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Oxford, southeastern Coos and northeastern Carroll Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Pinkham Notch, or 11 miles northwest of Conway, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conway, Fryeburg, Pinkham Notch, Waterford, Gorham, Bartlett, Lovell, Jackson, Albany, Chatham, Gilead, Sweden, Stowe, Stoneham, Batchelders Grant, Shelburne, Mason, Hart`s Location, Riley, and Randolph. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
